Kim Lunsford Spohn
August 18 at 11:08 AM ¬∑

Oak Hill Middle School 6th grade students will be met at the door with these bright pink signs and instructed to go to the gym. Students will be given a tour of the building, taken to lockers and then escorted to their first period class by their teacher. post_text: Welcome to the OHULS District Kick-Off for the 2020-2021 school year! Watch this video to see our students welcoming staff back and to hear a message from Dr. Shepard about the vision for Oak Hill schools!
text: Welcome to the OHULS District Kick-Off for the 2020-2021 school year! Watch this video to see our students welcoming staff back and to hear a message from Dr. Shepard about the vision for Oak Hill schools!

post_text:
Dear Community - You are invited!
District Kick-Off is an event that brings all staff together at the beginning of the year. This year the event will be online to allow for social distancing. The silver lining is YOU can join us this year! I (Dr. Shepard) listened to our community and will be sharing the vision for our district. There will be lots of student voice throughout the Facebook live event, so you are in for a treat!

Date: Monday, August 17th, 2020
Time: 8:15 AM (8:00 AM for staff)
Place: Oak Hill Union Local School District Facebook page

post_text: Governor DeWine issued a travel advisory and mask order to begin at 6:00pm July 23, 2020. We used information from the Governor‚Äôs office as well as guidance from Ohio Department of Education, Ohio Department of Health, and the Centers for Disease Control to update our 2020-2021 Reopening and Academic Continuity Plan. You will see these changes under the "Resources" section (pages 5-6) of our plan. Our plan will continue to change as new mandates are given, and we will keep you informed of those changes. www.oakhill.k12.oh.us

post_text:
Meet Isaac. Isaac is going to be a preschooler and is going to school for the first time! On the 4th of July, families still didn‚Äôt know if schools were going to open in the fall. That‚Äôs when Isaac came up to me (Dr. Shepard) and said, ‚ÄúI want to go to school.‚Äù It melted my heart. We are taking safety precautions so that Isaac and other kids can go to school!

This is an extra special time in the lives of our preschoolers and kindergarteners! Preschool and kindergarten registration is happening now! Please call Oak Hill Elementary 740-682-7096 or email whitney.crabtree@oakhill.k12.oh.us for more information.

We welcome our newest Oaks! #OnceAnOakAlwaysAnOak

post_text:
Although we don‚Äôt know what school will look like in the fall, our district is preparing for fall now so that we can be nimble with various scenarios for school next year. This week, all teachers are engaging in technology training a) to support learning in school that prepares students to learn and work in our digital and connected world AND b) to support remote learning that provides academic continuity for students if there are school closures.

It is our hope that students can come back to school in August. ‚ù§Ô∏è
text:
Although we don‚Äôt know what school will look like in the fall, our district is preparing for fall now so that we can be nimble with various scenarios for school next year. This week, all teachers are engaging in technology training a) to support learning in school that prepares students to learn and work in our digital and connected world AND b) to support remote learning that provides academic continuity for students if there are school closures.

It is our hope that students can come back to school in August. ‚ù§Ô∏è

post_text:
You know it and I know it. OAK HILL ROCKS!

In the month of April we shared staff photos with messages to kids to bring us #OakHillTogether.

In the month of May we have a new activity we can do #OakHillTogether! We invite you to create, place, and find painted rocks around our town!

Watch the video, and the Smittle kids will tell you how it‚Äôs done! They also got us started with surprises around town!

Directions:
1. Start with a clean, dry rock
2. Use acrylic paint, paint markers, or permanent markers
3. When dry, coat your rock with an outdoor acrylic sealer
4. Add #OakHillTogether
5. Place your rock in a public place in Oak Hill
6. When you find a rock, you can take a photo of it and share it. Add #OakHillTogether to your post so we can see your finds!

Happy creating and hunting!
#OakHillRocks

Bellisio Foods‚Äô Food Giveaway- May 3rd (12pm to 3pm) Oak Hill Site: please enter into the main entrance from SR93. Follow traffic up into the upper parking lot. You will be directed when to pull down to pick up 2 cases per car. These will be handed into your passenger window. You will then exit through the lower lot, turning right on 93 south. We look forward to seeing you!!!!

post_text:
Update: After meeting with the Health Department on Thursday (4.30.20), each graduate will be allowed FOUR family member witnesses rather than two!

Thursday afternoon (4.23.20), the State announced new graduation ceremony guidelines. Today, the Jackson County Health Department articulated what that means for our County. As a result, we need to adjust our graduation plan. We remain COMMITTED to making the graduation ceremony special and creative for our graduates! Please see the letters from Dr. Shepard and the Jackson County Heath Department on our website (http://www.oakhill.k12.oh.us). We will keep you informed as the situation evolves and our plans develop. We are #OakHillTogether

post_text:
In honor of the Senior class of 2020, Oak Hill Union Local Schools will participate in a recognition ceremony. Davis Stadium lights will be on tonight (4/20/20) at 20:20 military time (8:20 pm) for 20 minutes and 20 seconds. We will set the scoreboard to show 20-20.

We invite you to join us by turning on your porch lights at that time.

Oak Hill Seniors - WE SEE YOU!
Go Oaks!

#OakHillTogether
#UnitedFor2020

ANNOUNCING WIFI ACCESS!
To support remote learning, Oak Hill students and staff can access Wi-Fi in the parking lot near the main entrance of the high school. post_text:
Dear Oak Hill Community,

It is with deep sorrow that we share the news of the death of Joseph Sharp, an 8th grade student in the Oak Hill School District. Oak Hill is a close-knit community, and we extend our collective heartfelt sympathy to his family and friends.

We would like to offer support during this difficult time. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact your child‚Äôs school so we can make our counselors available to you remotely. You can also call 1-800-252-5554 or 1-800-321-8293 to speak with a grief counselor. We have also posted resources with other ways to support adults and children on our website.

The Oak Hill family is deeply saddened and Joseph will be greatly missed.

Marci

Dr. Marci Shepard
Superintendent
text:
Dear Oak Hill Community,

It is with deep sorrow that we share the news of the death of Joseph Sharp, an 8th grade student in the Oak Hill School District. Oak Hill is a close-knit community, and we extend our collective heartfelt sympathy to his family and friends.

We would like to offer support during this difficult time. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to contact your child‚Äôs school so we can make our counselors available to you remotely. You can also call 1-800-252-5554 or 1-800-321-8293 to speak with a grief counselor. We have also posted resources with other ways to support adults and children on our website.

The Oak Hill family is deeply saddened and Joseph will be greatly missed.

Marci

Dr. Marci Shepard
Superintendent

post_text:
Who is ready for some GOOD news?
For the 5th year in a row, Oak Hill Union Local Schools has been honored with the ‚ÄúBest Communities for Music Education‚Äù designation from the NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education!
A huge shout out to elementary and secondary music teachers and supporters!

shared_text:
Oak Hill Elementary
April 3 at 5:50 PM ¬∑

Work Pick-Up for Oak Hill Elementary

Monday, April 6th, 2020

Work for Oak Hill Elementary Students
@ Oak Hill Elementary

10:00 AM - 12:00 PM
3:00 PM - 5:00 PM

Work pick-up will be done as a drive-thru. Cars will follow the morning student drop-off route at the front of Oak Hill Elementary. Staff will bring the packets to your car as you pull up to the door.

*** Any work not picked up will be placed on bus routes on Thursday, April 9th, during the meal distribution bus routes.***

*** Monday's lunch delivery has not been changed this and will run as normal. ***

*** At this time, work can be kept at home and combined with the new second work packet. Students can email pictures of work with teachers at any time. ***

If you have any questions, call can be made to the Oak Hill Elementary office on Monday, April 6th, 2020, from 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM.

We miss you all and hope everyone is staying safe and healthy!!!!

post_text: This is the official Facebook page for Oak Hill Union Local Schools. We want to connect with you and provide timely information in a variety of ways. We are expanding our communication methods to include Facebook and auto-emailing families. We will continue to post information on our website, use text alerts, and make auto-calls.
